page.title: 20St.Gregory's School,Marnhull
page.content: Marnhull has two primary schools for children aged 4 to 11.There is an area Roman Catholic School and St.Gregory's Church of England School for most of the village children.St.Gregory's was built in 1874 and extended and modernized in 1957 and 1971.Today there are about 100 pupils and 4 staff. Children attend here from Marnhull and Hinton St.Mary and go on to either Gillingham School or Sturminster High School for secondary education. This Domesday Survey was carried out by the two top classes of St.Gregory's School together with their teachers Mr.K.Budgell and Mr.A.Duddridge in the Summer Term 1985.
